post.Title: Java desktop links of the week, September 14
post.Content:
A good number of links this week. Enjoy!

  • If you are going to JavaOne this year and are a member of the Java desktop community,  you should sign up for my sixth annual Java Desktop Lunch!
  • Tom Eugelink has posted a follow-up to his JavaFX on mobile explorations where he focuses on performance tuning.
  • Speaking of JavaFX on mobile, Pedro Duque Vieira has posted a video of JavaFX running on his (relatively ancient) Nexus 4 phone.
  • Continuing along with JavaFX mobile developments, the Gluon blog has two posts this week. Firstly, the first Gluon Newsletter has just been posted. Secondly, Gluon Charm developer preview 3 has just been released.
  • Dirk Lemmerman has an interview with Eurovision Broadcasting Union, a company heavily invested in using JavaFX.
  • Hendrik Ebbers has posted about how to create a responsive layout in JavaFX.
  • Andres Almiray is recreating the Twitter Bootstrap look in JavaFX CSS with a new project called BootStrapFX.

Catch you next week with another round of links :-)
